creator: milamber@apache.org
text:
[Just for archive]

The menus and contextual menus have incorrect position when JMeter run on GNOME 3 / Java 6 (openjdk or oracle jdk).

It's a known issue from Java runtime
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=698295

A workaround is to use a Java 7 runtime (openjdk or oracle jdk).

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Perhaps add to the JMeter release notes ?

Probably too late for 2.9, but could be mentioned in the announce and on the website.

creator: jmeter@erlewein.org
text: *** Bug 56015 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: milamber@apache.org
text:
This known bug is annotated on Known bugs list on JMeter website:
http://jmeter.apache.org/changes.html#Known%20bugs

"With Java 1.6 and Gnome 3 on Linux systems, the JMeter menu may not work correctly (shift between mouse's click and the menu). This is a known Java bug (see Bug 54477 ). A workaround is to use a Java 7 runtime (OpenJDK or Oracle JDK). "
